q0.question: What causes the Vikings to experience fear?
q0.recall: The Vikings finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix.
q0.vectordb: The Vikings experience fear because they believe that fear gives their enemies wings and makes them invincible. They seek to find a "Champion of Fear" who can teach them to be great cowards so they can fly. However, they finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix during a wedding celebration. According to Getafix, fear is necessary to be courageous. Justforkix, the Viking they are training, runs screaming from any danger and refuses to drink non-organic potion. Source: k-2, k-5, k-7, k-8
q0.hybrid: The Vikings experience fear because they believe that fear gives their enemies wings and makes them invincible. They seek to find a "Champion of Fear" who can teach them to be great cowards so they can fly. However, they finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix during a wedding celebration. According to Getafix, fear is necessary to be courageous. Justforkix, the Viking they are training, runs screaming from any danger and refuses to drink non-organic potion. Source: k-2, k-5, k-7, k-8

q1.question: Why does Cryptograf say the enemies are always gone?
q1.recall: Cryptograf says the enemies always disappear because "Fear gives them wings".
q1.vectordb: Cryptograf says the enemies always disappear because "Fear gives them wings". He suggests finding a "Champion of Fear" who can teach them to be great cowards so they can fly, making them invincible. He hatches a secret plan to seize power and tells the chief they'll find the Champion of Fear in Gaul. The Vikings later experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix. When Asterix asks him what fear is good for, Getafix explains that we can only be courageous when we have some kind of fear to overcome. Cryptograf's plan involves capturing the Champion of Fear and claiming the prize of anything he wants, which Cryptograf says is the chief's daughter, Abba. Since the chief has no son, this would put Olaf in line to become the next chief (with Cryptograf calling the shots, of course). Olaf captures Justforkix, and Asterix and Obelix have to retrieve him before the next full moon when his father, Doublehelix, plans to return to their village. Asterix and Obelix arrive on Iceland shortly after the Vikings, but they can't rescue Justforkix. He doesn't want to leave because he considers the Vikings (especially Abba) as his friends. However, the Vikings decide to test Justforkix's flying skills by throwing him off a cliff. Cryptograf secretly rigs up a rope to Justforkix, allowing him to be suspended in the foggy air and thus convincing the Vikings that he really can fly.
q1.hybrid: Cryptograf says the enemies always disappear because "Fear gives them wings". He suggests finding a "Champion of Fear" who can teach them to be great cowards so they can fly, making them invincible. He hatches a secret plan to seize power and tells the chief they'll find the Champion of Fear in Gaul. The Vikings later experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix. When Asterix asks him what fear is good for, Getafix explains that we can only be courageous when we have some kind of fear to overcome. Cryptograf's plan involves capturing the Champion of Fear and claiming the prize of anything he wants, which Cryptograf says is the chief's daughter, Abba. Since the chief has no son, this would put Olaf in line to become the next chief (with Cryptograf calling the shots, of course). Olaf captures Justforkix, and Asterix and Obelix have to retrieve him before the next full moon when his father, Doublehelix, plans to return to their village. Asterix and Obelix arrive on Iceland shortly after the Vikings, but they can't rescue Justforkix. He doesn't want to leave because he considers the Vikings (especially Abba) as his friends. However, the Vikings decide to test Justforkix's flying skills by throwing him off a cliff. Cryptograf secretly rigs up a rope to Justforkix, allowing him to be suspended in the foggy air and thus convincing the Vikings that he really can fly.

q2.recall: The Vikings are looking for the Champion of Fear for a prize, which is the chief's daughter.

q2.hybrid: The Vikings are looking for the Champion of Fear for a prize, which is the chief's daughter.

q5.question: When do the Vikings finally experience real fear?
q5.answer: ['When they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix.']
q5.recall: The Vikings finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix, back in the Gaulish village during the celebration of Justforkix and Abba's wedding.
q5.vectordb: The Vikings finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix during the wedding of Justforkix and Abba in the Gaulish village.
q5.hybrid: The Vikings finally experience real fear when they hear a ballad sung by Cacofonix, back in the Gaulish village during the celebration of Justforkix and Abba's wedding.

q6.question: How do the Vikings test Justforkix's flying skills?
q6.recall: The Vikings decide to test Justforkix's flying skills by throwing him off a cliff.
q6.vectordb: The Vikings test Justforkix's flying skills by throwing him off a cliff, but Cryptograf secretly rigs up a rope to suspend him in the air and convince the Vikings that he can fly. Later, Justforkix discovers that he can fly as he rescues Abba using a hang-glider improvised from a ship's mast and sail.
q6.hybrid: The Vikings test Justforkix's flying skills by throwing him off a cliff, but Cryptograf secretly rigs up a rope to suspend him in the air and convince the Vikings that he can fly. Later, Justforkix discovers that he can fly as he rescues Abba using a hang-glider improvised from a ship's mast and sail.

q7.question: What does the chief say he'll give to whoever can bring him this Champion of Fear?
q7.recall: The chief says he'll give anything to whoever can bring him this Champion of Fear.
q7.vectordb: The chief says he'll give anything to whoever can bring him the Champion of Fear.
q7.hybrid: The chief says he'll give anything to whoever can bring him the Champion of Fear.

q8.question: Who is Cryptograf?
q8.answer: ['He is  advisor to Viking chief Timandaha.']
q8.recall: Cryptograf is an advisor to Viking chief Timandahaf who hatches a secret plan to seize power and suggests finding the Champion of Fear in Gaul. He also secretly rigs up a rope to Justforkix to convince the Vikings that he can fly.
q8.vectordb: Cryptograf is an advisor to Viking chief Timandahaf.
q8.hybrid: Cryptograf is an advisor to Viking chief Timandahaf who hatches a secret plan to seize power and suggests finding the Champion of Fear in Gaul. He also secretly rigs up a rope to Justforkix to convince the Vikings that he can fly.
